intro: Amellus asper var. glabriusculus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved amellus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Amellus genus. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and compact growth habit, which distinguish it from other varieties in the species. Native to specific regions in southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and full sun exposure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
